title: Ben Stokes breaks silence on ‘irresponsible’ domestic abuse claims
text:
Ben has now addressed the allegations (Picture: Backgrid/Twitter/clarey_11)

Ben Stokes has been forced to slam claims he attacked his wife Clare, after images emerged from the 50th NatWest PCA Awards which show Ben holding Clare around the neck and pushing her backwards.

In response, the pair have insisted that the allegations are ‘nonsense’ and they regularly ‘squish each other’s face’ to ‘show affection’.

Now Ben has released a statement, slamming the accusations as ‘irresponsible’ as he hits out at people ‘making stuff up’ about the sportsman.

Ben said in a statement: ‘I have become used to people making stuff up about me, but of all the topics not to mess with domestic abuse has to be at the top of the list.

‘It’s an incredibly serious issue for thousands of women – and men – who do suffer domestic abuse.’

The pair arrived together at their hotel (Picture: CRYSTAL PIX / BACKGRID)

Ben won the players player of the year award earlier on (Picture: Getty Images Europe)

The 28-year-old continued in the message to the Mirror: ‘For it to be toyed with for cheap headlines in this way just damages the cause of those who are abused.

Advertisement

‘Clare is a strong, independent woman who can speak for herself.

‘We have a wonderful relationship and I never tire of saying how lucky I am to be with her.’

He added: ‘We both had a great night at the PCA Awards, ending with us dining out at McDonald’s together.

‘To falsify and spread these kind of allegations so willingly is totally irresponsible.’

Clare followed Ben into their hotel (Picture: CRYSTAL PIX / BACKGRID)

Addressing the controversial photos on Good Morning Britain, Piers Morgan said on Wednesday: ‘They were seen around this picture being taken having a great night, having a few drinks. They carried on having a great night, posted pictures of them and so on.

‘It’s an interesting one, you have to take them at face value I think, you have to listen to what they say about it. They say it’s not what it looks like.’

Sharing his own insider knowledge, Piers continued: ‘I’m told they both like a party, they like a bit of a drink occasionally together and they are a bit boisterous together and that’s literally what it was, which might be the case. I’ve no reason to doubt them.

‘I think it’s one of those things, it’s totally emphatic.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Taking to Twitter following the publication of the images, Clare shared her own denial, as she wrote: ‘Unbelievable what nonsense these people will make up!

‘Me and Ben messing about squishing up each other’s faces cos that’s how we show affection and some pap tries to twist it in to a crazy story!

‘And all before we then have a romantic McDonalds 20 mins later!’

She tagged Ben in her tweet and he later retweeted and added a kissing emoji.

Clare and Ben became engaged in 2013 and married four years later in 2017; they are parents to a six-year-old son and four-year-old daughter.

Ben helped England win the World Cup for the first time earlier in 2019, when he made 84 not out in the final before he was chosen to bat in the tie-breaking super over. He also made 135 runs to help England to a thrilling win in the third Ashes Test against Australia at Headingley.

However, the past 12 months have seen him found guilty of bringing the game into disrepute by the England and Wales Cricket Board. A sanction came after the England star was involved in a late-night brawl in the streets of Bristol in 2018.

The player accepted he had punched two men on a night out, but said he was acting in the defence of Mr O’Connor and Mr Barry, who had suffered homophobic abuse.

Advertisement

In court, the sportsman maintained that he heard Mr Ali and Mr Hale directing homophobic abuse at Mr O’Connor and Mr Barry.

After two hours of deliberation, he was cleared of affray at Bristol Crown Court but still faced the cricket sanction from the CDC; he was fined £30,000 and banned for eight matches, all of which he had already served by that time.
